The pop-up editor is the same WYSIWYG editor that their landing page editor uses, so it's easy to build beautiful pop-ups (not to mention, they've got great templates available, too).</p> \n<p>Unbounce has also built a substantial community of users, agencies, and developers. So if you're looking for help with design, SEO, or PPC campaigns, there are so many agencies that specialize with Unbounce.</p> \n<p>One of the coolest features they've recently launched is \"smart traffic.\" This feature uses machine learning to dynamically deliver the right landing page to the right traffic (my guess is through <a href=\"https://conductrics.com/going-from-ab-testing-to-ai-optimization-as-reinforcement-learning/\">reinforcement learning</a>, but who knows).</p> \n<p><strong>Pros</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Easy to use WYSIWYG editor</li> \n <li>Huge community and brand support</li> \n <li>Good customer support</li> \n <li>Mobile-friendly editor</li> \n <li>Strong lead capture tools</li> \n <li>Smart traffic delivers ML-based landing page automation</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Cons</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Starting price is a bit more expensive than competitors</li> \n <li>Drag-and-drop functionality can get a little buggy, so your best best is to work with a coder or designer</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Starts at $80/month</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%2011%20Best%20ClickFunnels%20Alternatives%20%26%20Competitors%20in%202020.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<h3>4. Instapage</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://instapage.com/\">Instapage</a> is one of the most popular landing page tools on the market.</p> \n<p>They're well-respected among marketers, and offer one of the most scalable solutions when it comes to high-budget growth marketing programs. This includes programmatic personalization, solid experimentation functionality embedded within the product, and AdMaps to visualize the mapping between your pre-click experience on ads and your post-click experience on landing pages.</p> \n<p>Underpinning all of this advanced technology is a user-friendly page builder that any marketer can master easily.</p> \n<p><strong>Pros</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Powerful feature set great for high scale marketing teams</li> \n <li>AdMap visualizations to link up ad creative to landing pages</li> \n <li>Personalization and experimentation embedded in product</li> \n <li>Strong reputation for lightning fast page speed</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Cons</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Higher price point than other alternatives</li> \n <li>Lack of native messaging or campaigns features</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Starts at $199/month</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%2011%20Best%20ClickFunnels%20Alternatives%20%26%20Competitors%20in%202020-Sep-21-2020-06-04-52-64-PM.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<h3>5. Wishpond</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.wishpond.com/\">Wishpond</a> is an all-in-one marketing platform that might be one of the easiest to use.</p> \n<p>First off, they have a stunning array of features. They have ads tools for Instagram, Facebook, and Google, social media promotion tools, email marketing software, lead management, referral programs, landing pages, website pop-ups, cart abandonment triggers, forms, call tracking, and automation.</p> \n<p>So if you want the full bucket of features and then some, Wishpond is an impressive platform.</p> \n<p>The tools are all built for marketers, so they're easy to use without the help of a developer.</p> \n<p><strong>Pros</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Every feature a marketer could wish for</li> \n <li>Easy-to-use page editor</li> \n <li>Great pop-up building and behavioral triggering</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Cons</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Too many features can get confusing and not all are best in breed</li> \n <li>A/B testing functionality is limited</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Starts at $75/month</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%2011%20Best%20ClickFunnels%20Alternatives%20%26%20Competitors%20in%202020-4.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<h3>6. GetResponse</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.getresponse.com/\">GetResponse</a> is one of my favorite all-in-one marketing platforms. To be honest, I've mainly used them and love them for their <a href=\"https://www.adamenfroy.com/best-email-marketing-services\">email marketing solution</a>. Great deliverability.</p> \n<p>But their landing page builder is also impressive. They have some unique features, like robust marketing automation and webinars, as well as some standard tools like forms and pop-ups.</p> \n<p>You can easily set up sales funnels or lead magnet funnels, and you can even manage and create social media ads in the platform. Sitting on all of this is a powerful set of analytics tools to visualize exactly how your funnels are performing.</p> \n<p><strong>Pros</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Amazing email marketing tool</li> \n <li>Easy-to-use page builder</li> \n <li>Sales and lead magnet funnels</li> \n <li>Integrated webinar functionality</li> \n <li>Affordable entry price</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Cons</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Too many features leaves some neglected (lead capture tools aren't super strong)</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Starts at $15/month</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%2011%20Best%20ClickFunnels%20Alternatives%20%26%20Competitors%20in%202020-Sep-21-2020-06-04-51-66-PM.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<h3>7. Keap</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://keap.com/\">Keap</a>, formerly known as Infusionsoft, is one of the premier marketing automation solutions out there.</p> \n<p>Since rebranding and rolling up into Keap, the company has built out a robust platform complete with a CRM as well as various sales features like invoice management, an appointment scheduler, and a sales pipeline manager.</p> \n<p>However, most marketers know this company for <a href=\"https://keap.com/infusionsoft\">Infusionsoft</a>, the powerful and long running marketing automation platform. This tool has the whole suite — landing pages, lead capture tools like forms and pop-ups, an email delivery service, automation functionality, and pretty good native analytics reports.</p> \n<p>All of this makes it a wonderful solution to manage your sales funnel and online business in general.</p> \n<p><strong>Pros</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Powerful and flexible automation features</li> \n <li>Strong community and support network</li> \n <li>Integration with Keap's CRM and sales tools</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Cons</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Can be a difficult learning curve with some features</li> \n <li>More expensive than other tools on this list</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Starts at $199/month</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%2011%20Best%20ClickFunnels%20Alternatives%20%26%20Competitors%20in%202020-2.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<h3>8. Elementor</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://elementor.com/\">Elementor</a> is an insanely popular WordPress page builder.</p> \n<p>While many ClickFunnels alternatives on this list are full featured marketing platforms, you can get pretty far with WordPress, a page builder like Elementor, and a messaging service (there are many <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-free-email-marketing-tools\">free email marketing tools</a>).</p> \n<p>Elementor has over 5 million active installations on WordPress, and it's easy to see why. It's an incredibly easy-to-use landing page builder, and any marketer can use it to quickly get started building beautiful pages.</p> \n<p>Moreover, it starts out free and is quite affordable even at the paid tiers.</p> \n<p>If you need a simple and effective page builder to act as a funnel builder, Elementor is a great option.</p> \n<p><strong>Pros</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Easy to use drag-and-drop editor</li> \n <li>Hundreds of premium templates</li> \n <li>Dozens of embedded widgets available</li> \n <li>Plug-and-play with WordPress</li> \n <li>Affordable</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Cons</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Only builds pages, so you'll have to use other tools for messaging and automation</li> \n <li>Sometimes lacks flexibility and customization</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Starts free, next plan begins at $49/year</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%2011%20Best%20ClickFunnels%20Alternatives%20%26%20Competitors%20in%202020-Sep-21-2020-06-04-51-15-PM.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<h3>9. Landingi</h3> \n<p>In my opinion, <a href=\"https://landingi.com/\">Landingi</a> is one of the most underrated landing page builders.</p> \n<p>First off, it's easy to use. Additionally, they've got a powerful assortment of features, including a mobile-friendly design editor, pop-ups and lead capture functionality that you can use anywhere on your site, a ton of integrations, and optimization and testing capabilities in-app.</p> \n<p>Plus, this tool was built as a mobile-first landing page builder. It can often be frustrating designing mobile-friendly pages, so if that's a concern for you, you should consider this tool.</p> \n<p>Finally, if you're a WordPress user, they have a great <a href=\"https://wordpress.org/plugins/landingi-landing-pages/\">WordPress plugin</a> to help get you up and running.</p> \n<p><strong>Pros</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Mobile focused, so you can easily design beautiful mobile pages</li> \n <li>Lead capture and pop-up tools</li> \n <li>A/B testing and optimization features</li> \n <li>Easy to use</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Cons</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>No module building, so it's not the most scalable solution if you need tons of landing pages</li> \n <li>Not as feature rich as other solutions on this list</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Starts at $47/month</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%2011%20Best%20ClickFunnels%20Alternatives%20%26%20Competitors%20in%202020-Sep-21-2020-06-04-52-93-PM.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<h3>10. Ontraport</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://ontraport.com/\">Ontraport</a> is another all-in-one marketing solution.</p> \n<p>It starts with the Ontraport CRM, where all your data lives. Then you have email and SMS tools to communicate with your prospects and your customers.</p> \n<p>And of course, you have a great landing page builder. This also comes with embedded web forms and membership sites, which makes this a wonderful alternative to ClickFunnels.</p> \n<p><strong>Pros</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>All-in-one feature set that competes head to head with ClickFunnels and Infusionsoft</li> \n <li>Solid page builder</li> \n <li>Good customer support</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Cons</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Complains of buggy drag and drop functionality, especially creating emails</li> \n <li>Limitations and lack of flexibility with certain tools, like designing emails or landing pages</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Starts at $79/month</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%2011%20Best%20ClickFunnels%20Alternatives%20%26%20Competitors%20in%202020-Sep-21-2020-06-04-52-03-PM.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<h3>11. Pagewiz</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.pagewiz.com/\">Pagewiz</a> is a dedicated landing page builder — and a powerful one, at that.</p> \n<p>They're a product-led company, putting tons of resources into building a secure, easy-to-use, and flexible page builder. Therefore, if you want best in breed for your landing pages, this is a good bet.</p> \n<p>Pagewiz comes replete with every feature you need to build perfect pages — a mobile responsive editor, good <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/a-b-testing-tools\">A/B testing functionality</a>, video widgets, design features like parallax scrolling, and tons of ready-to-use templates.</p> \n<p>You can also integrate with pretty much any other marketing tool you're currently using.</p> \n<p><strong>Pros</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Great product reliability and rich feature set</li> \n <li>Forms and lead capture capabilities</li> \n <li>Mobile responsive editor</li> \n <li>Easy to use WYSIWYG<br>Many integrations</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Cons</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li>Not as much education, community or support materials for technical issues</li> \n <li>Lack of additional messaging and campaigns features</li> \n</ul> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Starts at $29/month</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%2011%20Best%20ClickFunnels%20Alternatives%20%26%20Competitors%20in%202020-1.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<h3 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">The 5 Best Free ClickFunnels Alternatives</h3> \n<p>1. HubSpot Marketing Hub</p> \n<p>2. Elementor</p> \n<p>3. Wix</p> \n<p>4. GrooveFunnels</p> \n<p>5. BuilderAll</p> \n<h3 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Finding the Best ClickFunnels Alternative</h3> \n<p>Whatever your reason for seeking a ClickFunnels alternative, know that there are many options on the market now and there will likely be more in the future. The marketing technology landscape continues to expand, not only giving marketers <em>more</em> options, but better and more powerful tools as well.</p> \n<p>Some tools on this list serve specific purposes, such as landing pages (Unbounce, Instapage, etc.), but some have all-in-one platforms that have all the features ClickFunnels has, and in some cases, many more.</p> \n<p>For an all around effective growth platform, <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/free\">HubSpot's Marketing Hub </a>is a great solution. You can start out free on many of the tools, including the landing page builder, form builder, CRM, and email marketing platform.</p> \n<p>Beyond that, the paid tiers increase the scope and power of what you're able to accomplish. The sky's the limit.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img 11:33:09","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:09","title":"15 of the Best Account-based Marketing Software for 2020","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/account-based-marketing-software","description":"<p>Are you in the market for your new <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/abm-software\">account-based marketing (ABM) software</a>?</p> \n<p>If so, then you've come to the right place.</p>  \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/account-based-marketing-guide?_ga=2.40494304.314314564.1588713293-940436819.1565181751\">Account-based marketing</a> means catering your message to the top decision-makers for target accounts with a blend of marketing of sales tactics — it's a strategy that targets companies, rather than individual customers.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>As HubSpot's Senior Manager (Accelerated Leadership Program), <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/ryan-batter-10855537/\">Ryan Batter</a> states, \"The beauty of using an ABM strategy is that it’s customizable to a team’s readiness and budget. Look for a <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm\">CRM</a> that enables strong integrations to ABM-specific tools to customize your strategy.\"</p> \n<p>With that in mind, let's look at account-based marketing software.</p> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/abm-software\">HubSpot ABM Software</a></h3> \n<p>HubSpot's ABM software lets you carry out a fully-fledged campaign right in your CRM. When using it, you can make an ideal customer profile, or ICP. This ICP will help HubSpot automatically tier prospects based on how good of a match they are to your profile.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/15%20of%20the%20Best%20Account-based%20Marketing%20Software%20for%202020-13.png?width=1500&amp;name=15%20of%20the%20Best%20Account-based%20Marketing%20Software%20for%202020-13.png\" alt=\"HubSpot account based marketing\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 1500px;\" width=\"1500\">\n</div> \n<div style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/abm-software\"><em>Source</em></a>\n</div> \n<p>Additionally, you can import a spreadsheet of your target accounts. This can also be done manually.</p> \n<p>HubSpot's software helps you identify challenges of prospects so you can personalize specific marketing messages to attract them. You can also use Marketing Hub tools, such as ads, web pages, and social media posts, to market to your customers and make your campaign successful.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://terminus.com/\">Terminus</a></h3> \n<p>Terminus is a platform that offers full-service ABM software. It helps you build account lists equipped with the data you need to personalize your strategies.<span style=\"color: #33475b;\"></span><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"></span></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%203.53.42%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%203.53.42%20PM.png\" alt=\"terminus account-based marketing platform\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://terminus.com/\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: left;\"><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">With Terminus, you can find accounts where they are and run campaigns that target them directly. For instance, you can manage retargeting, automation, and email campaigns within the software and access performance metrics of those campaigns. Analyzing these metrics will give you a better understanding of how to better target accounts.</span></p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://www.demandbase.com/solutions/abm-platform/\">Demandbase</a></h3> \n<p>Users of <a href=\"https://www.demandbase.com/solutions/abm-platform/\">Demandbase's</a> software experience ABM programs throughout the entire customer journey. The platform allows users to scale their efforts with accounts, rather than using a bunch of confusing point solutions.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%203.56.05%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%203.56.05%20PM.png\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"demandbase acount based marketing platform\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://www.demandbase.com/solutions/abm-platform/\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p>Demandbase was built with B2B marketing in mind and offers a user-friendly interface. Within the platform, you will find solutions for engagement and conversion. These help you identify potential accounts, personalize your strategy, and experiment with new ways to close deals.</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://triblio.com/\">Triblio</a></h3> \n<p>Triblio is an ABM platform that specializes in the growth of account pipelines. Users can leverage ads, analytics, web, and sales tools to help them execute a carefully constructed strategy to attract accounts.</p> \n<p>Additionally, users can find out when the best time to reach an account is based on the platform's ability to analyze the web behavior of industries — all from their dashboard.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: left;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/15%20of%20the%20Best%20Account-based%20Marketing%20Software%20for%202020-14.png?width=1500&amp;name=15%20of%20the%20Best%20Account-based%20Marketing%20Software%20for%202020-14.png\" alt=\"Triblio ABM software\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 1500px;\" width=\"1500\"><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"></span></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><span style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><a href=\"https://triblio.com/account-based-marketing/\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><em>Source</em></a></span></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: left;\"><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">With the software's one-to-one account marketing setup, you'll be able to target larger accounts and cater to their challenges directly, right from your dashboard. Triblio also offers a guide for ABM — think of it as a crash course — that teaches you how to use the software for your business.</span></p> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://6sense.com/\">6Sense</a></h3> \n<p>This platform focuses on providing its users with the intent of accounts. It provides users with the capabilities needed to engage with customers. With their service, you can collect insights about an account’s challenges and market to them in a way that provides immediate impact.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.31.55%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.31.55%20PM.png\" alt=\"6sense account based marketing example\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><span style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><a href=\"https://6sense.com/\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><em>Source</em></a></span></p> \n<p>With the engagement platform, you can align your sales and marketing strategies together using data. You'll be able to use the data provided about accounts to prioritize your strategy and engage customers based on their unique interests. With this setup, you can deliver consistent experiences that scale with your customer's journey.</p> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://www.engagio.com/\">Engagio</a></h3> \n<p>With Engagio, B2B marketers can provide a personalized approach to engagement for accounts. This is done by using the platform's tools for sales insights, multi-channel creation, and analytics that cover the entire buyer's journey.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.29.56%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.29.56%20PM.png\" alt=\"engagio account based marketing software example\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><span style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><a href=\"https://www.engagio.com/\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><em>Source</em></a></span></p> \n<p>Engagio's users are able to unify data from their accounts onto one platform, making easier and more accurate analysis possible. With that data, you can accurately align your sales and marketing strategies, highlight areas to focus on, and execute those strategies.</p> \n<h3>7. <a href=\"https://www.leandata.com/\">LeanData</a></h3> \n<p>LeanData's software is focused on providing its users with the data they need to connect with accounts accurately. You can use the software to align marketing and sales goals, as well as align revenue operations.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.30.49%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.30.49%20PM.png\" alt=\"lean data account based marketing example\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://www.leandata.com/\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p>If you want to unify the data and processes you use across your go-to-market (GTM) teams, LeanData is a great software option. You'll be able to build a GTM plan, execute it, and access performance analytics with the software.</p> \n<h3>8. <a href=\"https://bound360.com/\">Bound</a></h3> \n<p>This platform is intuitive and is built to provide marketers with the tools needed to personalize account-based strategy. With Bound, you can build audiences, create dynamic content, and measure the success of campaigns.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.12.17%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.12.17%20PM.png\" alt=\"bound abm software\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><span style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><a href=\"https://bound360.com/\" style=\"color: #0091ae;\"><em>Source</em></a></span></p> \n<p>Bound lets users analyze the web behavior of accounts and build audience segments based on that data. They can also choose how to target those segments using software offerings like email and copy templates. Finally, users can see how their segments are performing and adjust their personalization strategy as needed to best reach accounts.</p> \n<h3>9. <a href=\"https://zymplify.com/\">Zymplify</a></h3> \n<p>If you want to find prospective accounts and nurture those leads, Zymplify lets you do that on one platform. It offers automated lead qualification tools, so you can turn prospects into customers.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.14.06%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.14.06%20PM.png\" alt=\"zimplify abm example\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"><span style=\"font-size: 1.125rem; font-weight: 400;\"></span></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://zymplify.com/\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p>Their scale-based services let you cater to customers throughout their entire buyer's journey. Automated services, such as demand generation, prospect identification, sales, and reporting, saves marketers time when creating strategy.</p> \n<h3>10. <a href=\"https://www.madisonlogic.com/\">MadisonLogic</a></h3> \n<p>MadisonLogic is a platform that offers tools for ABM advertising and content syndication. With the software, you can also accelerate your accounts' customer journey, access insights about campaign performance, and offer a formatted content marketing package.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.16.03%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.16.03%20PM.png\" alt=\"madison logic abm example\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://www.madisonlogic.com/\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p>This software lets you engage with relevant advertising content, and syndicate that content across multiple channels. That way, you can easily find new and relevant contacts. With their content marketing formats, you can engage with your contacts in a highly stylized and compelling fashion.</p> \n<h3>11. <a href=\"https://www.activedemand.com/\">ActiveDemand</a></h3> \n<p>If you work for an agency, ActiveDemand is a great option to look into. It offers services specifically for agencies or marketers to execute their ABM campaigns.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.17.42%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.17.42%20PM.png\" alt=\"activedemand account based marketing ab, software\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://www.activedemand.com/\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p>ActiveDemand's software lets you engage accounts by delivering campaigns that are relevant and valuable to the challenges of prospects. It allows agencies and small businesses to execute campaigns by offering a full-service suite of tools. For instance, this software provides email marketing, content creation, reporting, and form building.</p> \n<h3>12. <a href=\"https://www.vainu.com/\">Vainu</a></h3> \n<p>Vainu is a platform that focuses on personalizing the interactions you make with accounts. Users are able to spot who is interacting with your content and why, so you can accurately enrich those leads. So, if conversion is one of your big goals for ABM, this might be a good choice.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.20.10%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.20.10%20PM.png\" alt=\"vainu abm software example\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://www.vainu.com/\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p>The platform aims to help its users find ideal potential accounts, know when to reach out to them, and how to send the message that will catch their attention. It offers synchronization features, such as company contacts, build customer lists, and provides ROI analytics based on sales functions.</p> \n<h3>13. <a href=\"https://www.leadiro.com/\">Leadiro</a></h3> \n<p>Leadiro is a B2B customer data platform that helps businesses connect directly to the key decision makers at companies. The software uses demographic profiles to help its users identify their ideal customers, and it offers segmentation tools to organize those prospects into lists, like what's shown below:</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/15%20of%20the%20Best%20Account-based%20Marketing%20Software%20for%202020-10.png?width=1500&amp;name=15%20of%20the%20Best%20Account-based%20Marketing%20Software%20for%202020-10.png\" alt=\"Leadiro ABM software\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 1500px;\" width=\"1500\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://www.leadiro.com/\"><em>Source</em></a></p> \n<p>This platform is extremely helpful for targeting because you can choose specific geographic regions in which to find prospects. If you want to generate more leads globally, this software is a good option. Leadiro also integrates with HubSpot, so customers of both can sync their data.</p> \n<h3>14. <a href=\"https://www.addaptive.com/\">AdDaptive Intelligence</a></h3> \n<p>With this service, users can target, engage, analyze, and optimize their account-based marketing campaigns. Its main focus is to provide its users with the tools to connect with high-value decision makers for B2B accounts.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/15%20of%20the%20Best%20Account-based%20Marketing%20Software%20for%202020-8.png?width=1500&amp;name=15%20of%20the%20Best%20Account-based%20Marketing%20Software%20for%202020-8.png\" alt=\"AdDaptive ABM software\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 1500px;\" width=\"1500\">\n</div> \n<div style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\">\n <a href=\"https://www.addaptive.com/\"><em>Source</em></a>\n</div> \n<p>AdDaptive's software lets you boost your advertising messages to the right business audiences to help you maximize ROI. It also has the capabilities to target customers, analyze advertising analytics, and optimize your future campaigns.</p> \n<h3>15. <a href=\"https://www.rollworks.com/pricing\">RollWorks</a></h3> \n<p>RollWorks is a software that helps you drive demand, run digital ad campaigns, and automate sales functions, such as customer outreach. Its software is based around turning target accounts into customers by using machine learning and data. This helps users identify ideal customers and engage them across multiple channels.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.34.31%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.34.31%20PM.png\" alt=\"rollworks abm software example\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.rollworks.com/pricing\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<p>The software lets you create an ideal customer profile so you can begin to find key contacts. You can also run cross-channel campaigns with the platform, and run digital ads through it. From those campaigns, RollWorks will analyze their performance and provide you with key metrics about their impact.</p> \n<p>Batter states, \"As teams increase commitment and budget to ABM, it likely makes sense to complement a CRM with more focused tools that can provide deeper sophistication in a certain category - ads targeting, company enrichment, intent data, events management.\"</p> \n<p>As your business grows, so will the tools you will need for account-based marketing. So, when you're picking software, make sure it's scalable, and can grow with you.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in May 2020 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img .17%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn43@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-48-775_f3f16bfd3dc9d837.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.14.06%20PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.14.06%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn76@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-47-948_25fa483fb7471a05.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.16.03%20PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.16.03%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn31@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-45-813_a4b43a9a9952f11a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.17.42%20PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.17.42%20PM.png":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.20.10%20PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.20.10%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn43@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-50-313_33d2f248103296a2.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/15%20of%20the%20Best%20Account-based%20Marketing%20Software%20for%202020-10.png?width=1500&name=15%20of%20the%20Best%20Account-based%20Marketing%20Software%20for%202020-10.png":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/15%20of%20the%20Best%20Account-based%20Marketing%20Software%20for%202020-8.png?width=1500&name=15%20of%20the%20Best%20Account-based%20Marketing%20Software%20for%202020-8.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn97@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-47-641_8dd40f918435bb64.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.34.31%20PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-07%20at%204.34.31%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn65@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-47-347_03c759b37e0b0dd7.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Faccount-based-marketing-software&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn90@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-52-117_d03baa059a6f3d1b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214389706},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:09","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:09","title":"What Is a Marketing Manager?","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-management","description":"<p>As&nbsp;marketers, we all want to climb the career ladder as quickly as possible. But if you're going to become a marketing manager one day, you first need to learn what the role demands.</p>  \n<p>Moving up in ranks means becoming more involved in the marketing process, and eventually becoming the principal implementor.</p> \n<p>As a marketing manager, you’d be in charge of a team. Employees will look up to you as you once looked up to your manager.</p> \n<p>However, accepting this position comes with increased responsibility. It can feel rewarding to watch your strategies come to life, but it’s important to understand what the role entails.</p> \n<p>Below, we'll go over what a marketing manager is, what a marketing manager does, the management process, and the skills and education you'll need to become one.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p> \n<h3>What does a marketing manager do?</h3> \n<p>Marketing managers have a variety of responsibilities. While there are industry-specific standards, there are common tasks that all marketing managers will do:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Conduct market research to understand the public interest and determine the marketability of products and services.</li> \n <li>Design creative and unique marketing strategies across multiple channels like social media, tv, billboards, and newspaper articles.</li> \n <li>Create marketing plans detailing outcomes and goals.</li> \n <li>Create comprehensive budgets and cost estimates.</li> \n <li>Negotiate with potential clients and partners to prepare sales and advertisement contracts.</li> \n <li>Handle public relations and troubleshoot internal and external issues as they arise.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Marketing managers are also responsible for training their team members on campaign-specific marketing plans. They’ll hire new employees to join their team, selecting those they believe will meet intended goals for executing brand strategy. They&nbsp;collaborate with all team members, motivating them to meet goals while providing guidance and delegating tasks.</p> \n<h2>Marketing Management Process</h2> \n<p>To succeed in their&nbsp;responsibilities, marketing managers follow a similar process. Each step in that process requires a unique approach depending on the product, service, or business.</p> \n<h3>Idea Generation</h3> \n<p>Marketing managers approach the idea generation stage with an intended product in mind or an idea for a product or service that a business hopes to create.</p> \n<p>They'll conduct market research to understand current trends and customer interest. If a new product is launching, are there competitors? How successful are they? What are consumers saying about available products, and how can they be improved?</p> \n<p>Understanding consumer interests and behaviors is key to beginning this process.</p> \n<h3>Marketing Plan</h3> \n<p>After identifying markets and understanding trends, marketing managers will develop a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-plan-template-generator?_ga=2.100934337.170348021.1600364963-337050714.1600364963\">marketing plan</a>&nbsp;that they'll use to implement their strategy. This plan identifies the target audiences, campaign-specific tactics, budget, and goals.</p> \n<p>They'll work with different teams, like UX product design, financial departments, and sales engineers, to develop a strategy that &nbsp;will allow the product to meet its intended goals. While a marketing manager is the chief decision maker, there may be financial aspects that they are not aware of. Collaboration between all teams ensures that the marketing plan is as comprehensive as possible.</p> \n<p>The marketing manager will likely conduct tests with intended audiences to ensure that the final marketing plan will drive the most revenue before implementation. This may take the form of focus groups, personal modeling, or consumer interviews.</p> \n<h3>Implementation and Results</h3> \n<p>At this point, the marketing manager will work with their team to implement the finalized marketing plan. Timelines will be set for tracking <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/essential-marketing-metrics?_ga=2.100934337.170348021.1600364963-337050714.1600364963\">campaign metrics</a>, using data to adapt the strategy if necessary.</p> \n<p>Regardless of campaign&nbsp;outcomes, all research and data will inform future marketing processes.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>Skills to Become a Marketing Manager</h2> \n<p>Most companies require their marketing professionals to have a bachelor's degree. Still, since the marketing industry adapts quickly, companies don't necessarily need their marketers or marketing managers to have specialized degrees in specific fields. Some companies may require professional degrees or memberships in professional associations.</p> \n<p>However, there is one universal requirement to become a marketing manager — a three- to five-year track record of consistently performing to your potential and achieving your goals. If you want to become a marketing manager one day, your performance as an individual contributor matters more than anything.</p> \n<p>For instance, if the main goal is to manage a company’s blog team, one would need to prove that they’ve consistently written quality content that has met their manager’s expectations.</p> \n<p>There are basic soft skills&nbsp;that a marketing manager should possess, like creativity, critical thinking, and leadership. However, a combination of these skills along with well-developed hard skills are crucial for job success. There are six essential skills an aspiring marketing manager should work to develop.</p> \n<h3>1. Communication</h3> \n<p>A marketing manager's job revolves around communicating with different audiences by developing creative content for advertisements, videos, and articles. This content must also be consistent with the tone, branding, and voice outlined in the marketing plan.</p> \n<p>The marketing manager will also be in conversation with their own managers, team members, and external stakeholders.</p> \n<p>Understanding how to confidently communicate with different audiences is critical for this role.</p> \n<h3>2. Budgeting&nbsp;</h3> \n<p>Marketing Managers handle all kinds of resources, from campaign budgets to pay-per-click ads to influencer marketing. All of these actions require budgeting skills.</p> \n<p>A marketing manager also handles &nbsp;internal budgets for their team, ensuring that everyone has the resources they need.</p> \n<h3>3. Negotiation</h3> \n<p>After creating the marketing plan, the marketing manager will need to convince internal stakeholders of its value. They’ll need to identify the right teams, and convince them of the benefits to the business and intended customers. Without internal buy-in, the campaign may cause internal confusion if all teams aren’t on the same page.</p> \n<p>The marketing manager may need to negotiate with other teams if they believe changes need to be made. They may agree with some suggested changes, but they’ll also need to know when to negotiate and advocate for certain elements of their plan if they are called into question.</p> \n<p>Externally, the marketing manager may be involved in financial negotiations with outside stakeholders to ensure that budgets aren’t over-spent.</p> \n<h3>4. Planning and Execution</h3> \n<p>Long term planning and goal setting are two important skills to be a marketing manager. They need to understand intended outcomes, plan for intended results, and execute the strategy to meet those outcomes. For example, is the ultimate goal to gain 1,000 Instagram followers? How will that happen? What steps need to be taken along the way to reach the goal?</p> \n<p>When managing multiple marketing channels and entire teams of people, understanding how much time to dedicate to all aspects of a campaign is essential.</p> \n<p>Can you create comprehensive plans to manage your tasks? Can you meet deadlines? Can you deliver high-quality work under said deadlines? These are questions that might be asked when interviewing for a marketing management position. &nbsp;</p> \n<h3>5. Collaboration and Delegation</h3> \n<p>Marketing managers lead an entire marketing team. Size may vary, but there are several people who will work under their direction.</p> \n<p>They need to work well with others and enjoy building relationships with internal teams and external stakeholders. However, it's still important to be a leader that can step in and assign tasks when necessary. For example, the marketing manager would ensure that their team members are assigned the right tasks for their skillset, and that individual performance aligns with task expectations.</p> \n<h3>6. Adaptability</h3> \n<p>Customer behavior and markets can be volatile, so adapting to changing industry standards is a must. For example, a strategy may need to be adapted after falling short on expected outcomes. Instead of giving up, the marketing manager should devise a plan with their team to come up with alternative options.</p> \n<h3>7. Empathy&nbsp;</h3> \n<p>Understanding markets means understanding consumer needs and predicting what they want and how they'll react to your service. This requires a significant amount of emotional intelligence.</p> \n<p>On their teams, marketing managers are responsible for balancing role expectations with team member’s capabilities. For example, if someone on&nbsp;their team is stressed because they aren’t meeting deadlines, it’s the marketing managers job to address the issue with empathy. An effective marketing manager would be able to recognize their stress and work with them to come up with effective ways to meet their goals.</p> \n<p>Ultimately, marketing managers develop unique, ambitious marketing strategies for products,&nbsp;</p> \n<p>businesses, and services. They create comprehensive marketing plans, and work with their teams to execute them successfully.</p> \n<p>A marketing manager ensures that products, services, and businesses have the best chance to thrive in their intended markets, satisfying both companies and consumers.</p> \n<p>Anyone who works to develop the skills outlined in this piece will be successful in their role as marketing manager.</p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fmarketing-management&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 06 Oct 2020 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"feb139340a2a87644bc068a1d59007d5","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"fneedle@hubspot.com (Flori Needle)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fmarketing-management&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn31@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-48-814_4b6c5443621753f2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214389711},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:09","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:09","title":"Everything Marketers Need to Know About Instagram Reels","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-reels","description":"<p>Throughout the past two years, two of the most popular apps used by <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/gen-z-stats\">Gen Z</a> and younger millennials were Instagram and TikTok.</p>  \n<p>While Instagram steadily pulled in <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/instagram-marketing\">more than 1 billion active users</a> since its 2016 debut, TikTok made news when it surpassed <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/tiktok-stats\">1 billion global downloads</a> within 18 months of its launch.</p> \n<p>Both networks have solid benefits and entertainment factors.. While Instagram's visual layout allows users to see images, videos, Stories, and live streams from their favorite accounts, TikTok provides an endless feed of short, entertaining video clips.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>But, late this summer, as countries including the U.S. <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/07/13/tiktok-privacy/\">considered banning TikTok due to privacy concerns</a>, Instagram launched a handful of new audio and video editing features that are quite similar to what users would find on TikTok. This new set of mobile features, which can be accessed in the Stories section of the Instagram app, has been dubbed Instagram Reels.</p> \n<p>Aside from allowing users to record videos with sound or audio overlays, the Reels camera and editor also includes the following features:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>More editing tools</strong>: These include augmented reality effects, transitions, and the ability to speed up or slow down videos.</li> \n <li><strong>Audio attribution</strong>: If a user uploads native audio, other users can overlay the sound in their videos while the app credits the original user's account for it.</li> \n <li><strong>Stitchable takes</strong>: This enables users to share a video with just one long take or a combination of quicker takes.</li> \n <li><strong>Shareability on the Instagram Feed, Explore, Stories, and your profile: </strong>Depending on the privacy settings of your profile, you can share Reels with just friends on your Stories or profile, or publicly in the Reels area of Explore.</li> \n <li><strong>Mobile-only: </strong>Unlike Instagram profiles and Stories, you can’t view or upload Reels on a desktop.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Right now, it's worth noting that ads are not yet supported in the Reels area of Instagram Explore. But since Reels show up in this public part of the app, and can be seen by people who don't follow your brand, your business has the opportunity to reach new audiences across the globe.</p> \n<p>At the time of this post, we also don’t know how the Instagram algorithm works for presenting Reels to audiences. But, based on our exploration of the Reels feed within Explore, it seems much like TikTok in that it prioritizes posts by location, people you follow, and content similar to what you've engaged with recently.</p> \n<h2>Why Instagram Launched Reels</h2> \n<p>According to Instagram -- which <a href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/08/05/instagram-reels-launches-globally-in-over-50-countries-including-u-s/#:~:text=Following%20Lasso's%20tests%2C%20Instagram%20released,parts%20of%20Europe%20in%202020.\">started testing Reels in Brazil in November 2019</a> and launched the feature globally this August -- the brand wanted to give users more content creation opportunities on its app.</p> \n<p>\"We’re excited to introduce Instagram Reels: a new way for anyone — people, creators, and businesses — to create and discover short, entertaining videos on Instagram,\" notes an August <a href=\"https://business.instagram.com/blog/announcing-instagram-reels\">announcement from Instagram</a>.</p> \n<p>While Instagram hasn't acknowledged TikTok's success or competition as a reason for launching Reels, several tech journalists have suggested that this was a strategic move.</p> \n<p>\"Instagram's short-form video feature, Reels, launched Wednesday. Instagram is swooping in at a vulnerable time for its largest competitor, TikTok. Reels allows users to create 15-second clips, like TikTok, and share them publicly or with friends within the Instagram app,\" wrote <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/05/facebook-launches-tiktok-competitor-instagram-reels.html\">CNBC's Jessica Bursztynsky</a>.</p> \n<p>While Reels is Instagram's first attempt at launching similar features to TikTok, this certainly isn't the first time a Facebook-owned company has launched similar video editing offerings.</p> \n<p>In 2018, amid TikTok's early success, <a href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2018/11/9/18080280/facebook-lasso-tiktok-competitor-app\">Facebook quietly launched</a> a competing app called Lasso.</p> \n<p>Lasso, which offered similar portrait-style feed and video editing tools to TikTok, had fewer than 80,000 app downloads by June 2020. In July, one month before the launch of Reels, Lasso was <a href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/07/01/lasso-facebook-tiktok-shut-down/#:~:text=Facebook%20is%20no%20longer%20betting,Lasso%20alerted%20users%20on%20Wednesday.&amp;text=Lasso%20allowed%20users%20to%20shoot,videos%20and%20overlay%20popular%20songs.\">discontinued</a>.</p> \n<p>\"We place multiple bets across our family of apps to test and learn how people want to express themselves. One of these tests was Lasso, our stand-alone short-form video app, which we have decided to shut down. We thank everyone who shared their creativity and feedback with us, which we’ll look to incorporate in our other video experiences,” a Facebook spokesperson told <a href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/07/01/lasso-facebook-tiktok-shut-down/#:~:text=Facebook%20is%20no%20longer%20betting,Lasso%20alerted%20users%20on%20Wednesday.&amp;text=Lasso%20allowed%20users%20to%20shoot,videos%20and%20overlay%20popular%20songs.\">TechCrunch</a>.</p> \n<p>At this point, knowing the history mentioned above, some marketers might wonder, \"Will Instagram Reels be a great TikTok alternative for my brand, or will it fail like other TikTok competitors?\"</p> \n<p>The question above is fair. After all, as a marketer, you'll only want to invest time and money into platforms with a solid track record, loyal audience, and great brand awareness opportunities, rather than those that could be discontinued a short time later.</p> \n<p>While Reels might have been flocked to by Gen Z if TikTok were banned, <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/09/20/914032065/tiktok-ban-averted-trump-gives-oracle-walmart-deal-his-blessing\"><span>TikTok's partnership deal with Oracle and Walmart</span></a> has ensured that this app will remain active in many countries -- at least for now. This means that even if Reels is successful, some audiences might still spend all of their time surfing TikTok.</p> \n<p>On the other hand, Instagram is a widely-used platform that has successfully launched competitive social media features before. Remember when <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/preferred-story-platforms\"><span>the brand launched Stories</span></a> and eventually <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/state-of-social-media-demographics\"><span>surpassed the user count of Snapchat</span></a>, which launched this feature first?</p> \n<p>At the moment, it's not clear whether Reels will be as successful as TikTok. But, since the feature only requires you to expand your Instagram strategy, rather than building out TikTok tactics from scratch, it could still be a great place for brands to test out highly experimental short-form content.</p> \n<p>If you're intrigued by Instagram Reels and ready to try it out, below I'll walk through how brands are already using the feature, steps for creating Reels content, and a few takeaways marketers should keep in mind as they build it into their Instagram marketing.</p> \n<h2>How Brands Already Use Reels</h2> \n<h3>Emmy Mae Bridal</h3> \n<p>Fashion and beauty are perfect for Reels, as is evident by this Reel from Emmy Mae Bridal in Queensland, Australia.</p> \n<p>In Emmy Rae's Reels, the brand presents videos and imagery of their wedding attire to the sounds classy music. Although we can't embed Reels, here's a screenshot of recent content the company posted.</p> \n<div style=\"\"> \n <img class=\"vidyard-player-embed\" src=\"https://play.vidyard.com/mSuWBwbWKXzpvzFmKdknmT.jpg\" width=\"200\" height=\"433\" style=\"display: block; max-width: 100%; margin: 0 auto; width: 200px; height: auto;\" alt=\"Bridal Instagram Reels\"> \n</div> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>Earth Official</h3> \n<p>The travel industry is also finding Reels to be an excellent way to reach people. In this piece of Reels content, Earth Official, an account that highlights travel content, deals, and influencers, shows beautiful footage of Thailand's lantern festival with native audio.</p> \n<div style=\"\"> \n <img class=\"vidyard-player-embed\" src=\"https://play.vidyard.com/BHPQRHNgJ39RuULLAUQqc3.jpg\" width=\"200\" height=\"433\" style=\"display: block; max-width: 100%; margin: 0 auto; width: 200px; height: auto;\" alt=\"Instagram Reels Travel EarthOfficial\"> \n</div> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>Critical Care Now</h3> \n<p>If your business isn’t exactly consumer-facing, Reels might still fit into your Instagram strategy, depending on how well you’ve cultivated your audience and how creative your content team is.</p> \n<p>In the Reels post below from <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/criticalcarenow/?hl=en\">CriticalCareNow</a>, an informative Instagram account run by resuscitation expert Haney Mallemat, Mallemat educates viewers about central and peripheral arterial lines used in the emergency response field.</p> \n<div style=\"\"> \n <img class=\"vidyard-player-embed\" src=\"https://play.vidyard.com/FipyGHAkjeY1N2K7sigtzZ.jpg\" width=\"200\" height=\"433\" style=\"display: block; max-width: 100%; margin: 0 auto; width: 200px; height: auto;\" alt=\"critical care Instagram Reels\"> \n</div> \n<p>Think the topic of the Reel above was too informative or formal for Instagram's audience? Think again. At the time this blog post was written, this Reel had more than 30,200 views. Pretty amazing for content that isn’t the latest dance move.</p> \n<p>Haney's Reel might be so engaging because he's done a great job of building a large, niche audience of over 24,000 Instagram followers and learned what types of content they value. While more followers could certainly get you more views, creating Reels around what your audience and similar users want to watch can also take your engagement a long way.</p> \n<h3>1. Enter Reels mode within Instagram Stories.</h3> \n<p>To get started with Reels, open the Instagram Stories camera and tap Reels.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-2.gif?width=200&amp;name=Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-2.gif\" alt=\"Instagram Reels can be found within Instagram Stories on the mobile app\" width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<h3>2. Explore the editing tools.</h3> \n<p>Before and after you record footage on your Reels camera, you'll see four editing icons on the left side of your camera screen.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-3.gif?width=200&amp;name=Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-3.gif\" alt=\"Effect options within Instagram Reels\" width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>The tools you'll see include:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Sound: </strong>Which enables you to add a pre-recorded sound from other users or Reels' featured song list to your content.</li> \n</ul> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-2.png?width=200&amp;name=Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-2.png\" alt=\"Sound overlay tool in Instagram Reels\" width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Playback Speed: </strong>This allows you to speed up or slow down content.</li> \n</ul> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor.png?width=200&amp;name=Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor.png\" alt=\"playback speed tool in Instagram Reels\" width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Effects: </strong>Tapping this icon, which looks like an emoji outline, allows you to add stickers and filter effects to your video. The filters for Reels are similar to Instagram Stories and many of these effects crossover between both video formats</li> \n</ul> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-Sep-16-2020-05-57-06-21-PM.png?width=200&amp;name=Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-Sep-16-2020-05-57-06-21-PM.png\" alt=\"Special effects tool in Instagram Reels\" width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Timer: </strong>If you can't hold down the Record button for the full clip, but want to make a video that lasts for a certain amount of time, you can tap this icon to set recording time for your clip. When you press record, a countdown of three seconds will appear on your screen before Reels starts to record. Then Reels will automatically film for the amount of time you designated.</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>3. Hold Record to begin filming, or upload a pre-recorded video.</h3> \n<p>Once you press and hold the record button, you'll start filming a clip. If you let go of the record button, but still have time left in your Reel video, you can hold the record button again to start a second clip that will begin immediately after the first ends.</p> \n<p>As you record one or multiple clips for your Reel, the progress bar at the top of the screen shows you how much recording time you have left.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor.gif?width=200&amp;name=Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor.gif\" alt=\"Progress bar in Instagram Reels\" width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>Alternatively, if you've already recorded a great video or TikTok that you think will be engaging on Reels, you can tap the camera icon to upload clips from your camera roll.</p> \n<h3>4. Add last-minute effects.</h3> \n<p>If you didn't add effects before the video started recording, but want to after seeing how it came out, you can add stickers, drawings, and text to your Reel before publishing.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-Sep-16-2020-05-57-04-92-PM.png?width=200&amp;name=Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-Sep-16-2020-05-57-04-92-PM.png\" alt=\"Adding last-minute effects after recording video in Reels\" width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>When you are finished, tap the arrow at the bottom when you’re ready to publish. Again, these effects are nearly the same as those you'll see on Instagram Stories.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-1.gif?width=200&amp;name=Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-1.gif\" alt=\"press next to go to posting page for Reels\" width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<h3>5. Prepare to publish your Reel.</h3> \n<p>When you press the arrow after reviewing the video and adding any last-minute effects, you'll be taken to the post screen, where you can choose a cover image, write a caption, add hashtags, and publish your video to Reels.</p> \n<h3>6. View your Reels.</h3> \n<p>Once you've published one or more Reels, this content will appear on the Explore page, as well as a tab on your profile.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-3.png?width=200&amp;name=Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-3.png\" alt=\"Where to find Instagram Reels on your profile\" width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<h3>7. Share your Reels.</h3> \n<p>Along with posting Reels for Explore audiences, you can also post them to your feed which will also cause them to appear on your main profile grid. Reels can also be sent as direct messages or even posted to your Instagram Stories. Unless you share a Reel so it appears on your main grid, the content will behave like a Story and disappear within 24 hours.</p> \n<h3>8. Monitor your performance.</h3> \n<p>Currently, to view any insights for a Reel, you need to view the post itself. At this time, there isn’t a way to view the analytics of your Reels within Instagram Insights. Instead, look at the likes and comments to get a sense of engagement.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-1.png?width=200&amp;name=Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-1.png\" alt=\"engagement metrics on Instagram Reels\" width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<h3>9. Watch Reels from other accounts.</h3> \n<p>To access Reels, simply go to search and you’ll see a featured Reel. Tap that and then you can easily scroll through the clips. From there, you can follow users and like, share, and comment on reels directly. You can find Reels on specific topics by searching for hashtags.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-Sep-16-2020-05-57-05-93-PM.png?width=200&amp;name=Everything%20You%20Need%20to%20Know%20about%20Instagram%20Reels,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Academys%20Social%20Media%20Professor-Sep-16-2020-05-57-05-93-PM.png\" alt=\"Where to find Instagram Reels content in Instagram Explore feed\" width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<h2>What to Keep in Mind with Instagram Reels</h2> \n<p>As you consider Reels, TikTok, and other emerging social media platforms in your marketing strategy, it's important to weigh the pros, cons, and key marketing takeaways when determining if a channel or feature is right for your team.</p> \n<p>Here are just a few things to remember as you consider Reels:</p> \n<h3>Reels competes against a unique, viral sensation:</h3> \n<p>Although Instagram has a huge audience that is loyal to its platform, many Gen Z users are used to going to TikTok for viral videos and general entertainment. Because the app has pulled in astounding fan loyalty in its short lifespan, you might find that Reels don't have the same viral opportunities that TikTok videos might have.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>What works on TikTok might not work on Reels</h3> \n<p>TikTok is a highly experimental platform with a younger, but huge, global audience. Because of these factors, there aren't many rules about what you should and shouldn't post on there. Meanwhile, Instagram has been around for years, has a slightly older audience, and has some content norms or audience expectations set in place</p> \n<p>If you've already posted a handful of TikTok videos and want to test them on Reels, you can consider uploading a few, watching how they perform, and learning more about what works well on both platforms.</p> \n<p>However, as you learn the differences between TikTok and Instagram audiences, you might find that high-performing TikToks aren't as engaging to your Reels audience. If this is the case, you might want to consider creating specialized content for Reels.</p> \n<h3>There aren't ad opportunities just yet.</h3> \n<p>Although you'll want to keep the points above in mind as you consider testing out Reels, you'll also want to remember the opportunities it offers. For example, Reels might be a great option for you if you've mastered Instagram, know what content your audiences want, and are eager to test out TikTok-styled content without using time and resources to build a full TikTok app strategy.</p> \n<p>If you do begin to test out Reels, it can't hurt to brush up on your Instagram marketing skills and Instagram platform knowledge to ensure that your profile, other content, and -- ultimately -- your Reels will be on point for your brand and optimized for brand awareness.</p> \n<p>Be sure to check out our <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-for-business-guide\">Ultimate Guide for Instagram Marketing</a>, or sign up for the free HubSpot Academy course below.</p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Finstagram-reels&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\"
