30.46%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn61@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-50-771_4892ef78b52f974b.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-09-15%20at%204.19.59%20PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-09-15%20at%204.19.59%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn47@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-50-082_0bcc88ef59133ac3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-09-17%20at%201.38.58%20PM-1.png?width=600&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-09-17%20at%201.38.58%20PM-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn80@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-47-981_8291392965eecd93.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-09-17%20at%201.49.19%20PM.png?width=600&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-09-17%20at%201.49.19%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn51@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-46-183_01e48395e658d412.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-09-17%20at%201.55.29%20PM.png?width=600&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-09-17%20at%201.55.29%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn58@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-47-374_b5d67fd3fdb0ff6e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-09-17%20at%201.56.02%20PM.png?width=600&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-09-17%20at%201.56.02%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn40@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-48-327_0f0cd722d58ab0a0.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-09-17%20at%201.56.55%20PM.png?width=600&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-09-17%20at%201.56.55%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn59@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-49-732_2b883e0fc62a4e20.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-09-17%20at%201.57.54%20PM.png?width=600&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-09-17%20at%201.57.54%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn19@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-53-152_350d094dcadefebe.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fgoogle-adwords-ppc&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn3@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-50-073_7c2d8152e79ea5df.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214389710},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:09","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:09","title":"Account-Based Marketing vs. Inbound Marketing: What's the Difference?","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/account-based-marketing-vs-inbound-marketing","description":"<p>Think about how much easier marketing is when you know <em>exactly</em> what companies to target and <i>what</i> marketing messages would best resonate with them. That's the dream, right?</p> \n<p>While we don't live in a perfect world, we do live in a world where inbound marketing and account-based marketing (ABM) exist. And, when these two strategies work together, this dream can become a reality.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>You may be pretty familiar with <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/inbound-marketing?_ga=2.69531664.1432473745.1588546996-940436819.1565181751\">inbound marketing</a> — creating content that attracts, converts, and delights customers.</p> \n<p>You may also know a thing or two about account-based marketing: aligning marketing and sales to deliver a consistent, personalized buying experience for prospects. But, because of their definitions, perhaps you think you have to choose between the two.</p> \n<p>Fortunately, you don't have to choose. In fact, instead of thinking \"ABM <em>versus</em> inbound,\" you should be thinking \"ABM <em>and</em> inbound.\"</p> \n<p>To clarify, let's define the two and offer some tactics around how to work these strategies into your existing marketing campaign.</p>  \n<h2>What is account-based marketing?</h2> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/account-based-marketing-guide?_ga=2.69531664.1432473745.1588546996-940436819.1565181751\">Account-based marketing</a> is a highly-targeted, focused growth strategy. It works by aligning marketing and sales functions to create a personalized experience for accounts, rather than an individual buyer.</p> \n<p>Instead of treating each of those buyers as an individual entity, ABM is a strategy that says, <em>\"Let's make sure we plan how to market and sell to all of those buyers as one account.\"</em></p> \n<p>This starts with <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/tried-and-true-sales-marketing-alignment\">aligning Sales and Marketing</a> to mutually choose a select set of accounts. Then, together they create marketing and sales strategies that target each account. This saves time for marketing and sales and delivers a far more consistent buying experience for the customers within each account.</p> \n<p>Businesses that are typically a good fit for using an ABM strategy are those that sell high-value products or services to other businesses, like B2Bs.</p> \n<p>The alignment of Sales and Marketing when using an ABM strategy helps you make more streamlined business decisions. It eliminates the time you would spend trying to sort out the best accounts to target, and instead, speeds up the process of delighting those prospects.</p> \n<p>ABM treats accounts as if they're individual buyers, and because of this, you'll be able to delight the key decision-makers with a personalized content strategy.</p> \n<p>So, ABM is a go-to strategy for shortening sales cycles, increasing ROI, and effectively selling to your highest value accounts in the way they each prefer to buy — but how is it comparable to inbound marketing? Let's talk about that next.</p> \n<h2>Account-Based Marketing and Inbound Marketing</h2> \n<p>ABM allows you to delight high-value accounts with a focused approach. Inbound marketing lets you attract customers through the creation of valuable, SEO-optimized content — it provides audiences with the information that's important to them in an organic manner.</p> \n<p>But what do they have in common?</p> \n<p>Both strategies require a deep understanding of your target buyer to inform what type of content you're creating &amp; how you choose to deliver it. This increases discoverability by that target.</p> \n<p>According to HubSpot's ABM Product Marketer, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/ryan-batter-10855537/\">Ryan Batter</a>, \"Every growth story begins with the same foundational elements of inbound marketing — building great content, crafting a publishing strategy, optimizing search presence to enable discovery of your brand and generate leads.\"</p> \n<p>You can repurpose content and use the same channels for ABM as you've already put into place with inbound. ABM is often just taking that foundational content and personalizing it even more.</p> \n<p>Both inbound and ABM are focused on delivering a great buying experience across the entire flywheel. ABM helps accelerate the flywheel once inbound foundation is in place.</p> \n<blockquote> \n <p>Additionally, the two strategies focus on targeted, personalized content. ABM hones in on delighting the right customers through content that is specifically created to cater to their challenges, an essential function of inbound marketing.</p> \n</blockquote> \n<p>Finally, the two help with the happiness and retention of your customers. Because an ABM strategy focuses on a set of specific accounts, you'll have more opportunity to focus on the happiness and retention of those clients, which is another essential part of the <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/flywheel\">inbound marketing flywheel</a>.</p> \n<p>That's not all, though — you can also use the two in a partnership to elevate your entire strategy.</p> \n<p>\"For some stories, companies benefit immensely by complementing their inbound foundation with account-based strategies that provide more personalized, tailored buying experiences for a subset of high-value leads,\" Batter says.</p> \n<p>Put another way: inbound marketing helps you attract the right customers. Then, account-based marketing uses marketing and sales to speed up the process of the flywheel and provide a valuable customer experience. In the end, both strategies enable you to win those target accounts.</p> \n<p>It's critical you approach your account-based marketing, the inbound way: provide valuable content and customer experiences to those high-value accounts.</p> \n<p>Using the two together helps you offer a more robust strategy. Plus, software, like the <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/cms\">HubSpot CMS</a>, allows you to experiment with the creation of campaigns that align with your businesses' goals.</p> \n<h2>How to Do Account-Based Marketing</h2> \n<p>To ensure you keep customers at the center of your account-based marketing strategy, stick to the principles. Make your account-based marketing strategy center around tailoring the way you communicate with your target company.</p> \n<p>There are five primary stages to account-based marketing that work hand-in-hand with inbound marketing. Let’s walk through each and detail how you can conduct ABM in a human-friendly way.</p> \n<h3>1. Identify</h3> \n<p>Account-based marketing begins with sales and marketing identifying and selecting relevant accounts. When beginning this selection process, data, such as company size, number of employees, location, and annual revenue, can give you an understanding of accounts you may want to target.</p> \n<p>Similar to inbound marketing, you can also use <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/make-my-persona\">buyer personas</a> to understand the day-to-day lives and challenges of your target buyers, then determine content and channels to approach them.</p> \n<h3>2. Expand</h3> \n<p>In sales where ABM is typically used, buying decisions are generally made by numerous individuals within a company. ABM helps establish a relationship with each potential buyer and engages them in the purchase decision.</p> \n<p>At the expand stage, creating unique, company-specific content that interests each potential buyer within the organization is important. Whether your product is for marketers, operations leaders, or anyone else, ensuring that you identify and engage with everyone in the buying decision is crucial to winning a customer.</p> \n<p>Consider the challenges each of your stakeholders faces in order to create compelling content. For example, Finance may be concerned with pricing, while Operations might be focused on user access, ease of use, and security. With this context, you can create targeted content and interactions that match each individual's concerns and challenges.</p> \n<h3>3. Engage</h3> \n<p>Here’s where sales and marketing come together and join the party to engage with stakeholders across various channels. For example, if one of your stakeholders prefers email, then equipping salespeople to reach out to that person with a helpful and relevant message can get a conversation started. This stage is largely about developing relationships with and getting to know all the buyers who will make the final decision.</p> \n<h3>4. Advocate</h3> \n<p>Next, you want to nurture bonds with a few stakeholders who can serve as advocates within the organization. The modern buyer can tune out information they don’t want to hear. So it’s up to both marketing and sales here to provide value — and talk about the product when and where necessary.</p> \n<h3>5. Measure</h3> \n<p>Finally, reporting at the account level can give you data on what's working, what's not, and how to improve over time. With <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/abm-software\">HubSpot ABM software</a>, you can report on company growth, revenue, job titles, engagement levels, and much more — all at the account level.</p> \n<p>For more information about how to align ABM with inbound, as well as some tactics for stellar account-based marketing tactics, be sure to check out this <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/account-based-marketing-guide?_ga=2.132102159.1432473745.1588546996-940436819.1565181751\">ultimate guide.</a></p> \n<p>If you're a company that sells into a smaller addressable market and has its sights on a handful of highly critical accounts, you can learn more about <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/can-account-based-marketing-and-inbound-marketing-co-exist-webinar?_ga=2.208636694.546617602.1588269536-940436819.1565181751\">building an ABM strategy without abandoning your inbound philosophy in this webinar.</a></p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in May 2020 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Faccount-based-marketing-vs-inbound-marketing&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 07 Oct 2020 20:06:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"2c8ba48b599af129787cd10fdb721932","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Kayla Carmicheal","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Faccount-based-marketing-vs-inbound-marketing&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn48@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-52-503_f175d0116c8dab2a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214389713},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:09","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:09","title":"36 Account-Based Marketing Stats to Know in 2020","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/account-based-marketing-stats","description":"<p>As marketers, we've become experts in our target audiences. We know their typical demographic, what they like, the platforms they spend time on, and what they value in a product.</p>  \n<p>But unlike sales reps — who talk to and learn from our biggest prospects each day — we don't always know tiny, but crucial, details about the brands or people we most want to sell too. This might be why <a href=\"https://www.stateofinbound.com/?__hstc=20629287.c53847d7cb04720312716e6ce3b1735e.1559596463572.1588099063502.1588105455987.940&amp;__hssc=20629287.3.1588105455987&amp;__hsfp=3157028737\">only 28% of salespeople</a> say marketing is their best source of leads.</p> \n<p>So, how do we bridge the gap to better help our sales teams sell to high-priority clients? The answer to this question could be <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/account-based-marketing-guide\">account-based marketing (or ABM)</a>.</p> \n<p>Rather than just marketing to a broad target audience and hoping someone calls your sales reps, ABM is a strategy where sales and marketing teams align from the start to create campaigns that cater to their most qualified leads and current customers.</p> \n<p>For example, as part of an ABM strategy, sales reps might offer marketing teams data from customers, prospects, and those that didn't buy a product so that the marketers can create a targeted campaign that amplifies why their product is valuable and how it can help targets navigate daily pain points.</p> \n<p>While <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/inbound-marketing\">inbound marketing</a> is vital for pulling general audiences and demographics to your site, service, or store, account-based marketing can help you to reel in prospects or qualified leads that are most likely to buy your product.</p> \n<p>To show you just how beneficial account-based marketing can be, while also informing you of the challenges it comes with, here are 36 stats you should know in 2020.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>36 Account-Based Marketing Stats to Know in 2020</h2> \n<h3>General ABM Stats</h3> \n<ul> \n <li>67% of brands leverage account-based marketing. (<a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/state-of-marketing\">HubSpot</a>)</li> \n <li>“Researching Accounts” and “Identifying Target Contacts” are the top two tactics used by marketers within an ABM model. (<a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/state-of-marketing\">HubSpot</a>)</li> \n <li>Just one year ago, the top five account-based tactics were sales development rep outreach, digital advertising, direct mail, marketing email, and events. (<a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/topo-2019-account-based-benchmark-report\">TOPO</a>)</li> \n <li>Additionally, marketers strongly agree that personalized content (56%) and advanced data management (43%) are keys to ABM's success. (<a href=\"https://www.forrester.com/report/Forrester+Infographic+ABM+Maturity+Corresponds+To+Better+Revenue+Results/-/E-RES157155\">Forrester</a>)</li> \n <li>Most organizations intentionally only pursue 38% of their target accounts at one time. (<a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/topo-2019-account-based-benchmark-report\">TOPO</a>)</li> \n <li>By 2019, 55% of marketers rated their ABM strategy as “established” compared to just 43% in 2018. (<a href=\"https://www.forrester.com/report/Forrester+Infographic+ABM+Maturity+Corresponds+To+Better+Revenue+Results/-/E-RES157155\">Forrester</a>)</li> \n <li>Companies dedicated 29% of their marketing budgets to ABM in 2019. (<a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/2019-abm-market-research-report?_ga=2.185632489.1363335365.1588108769-1977374832.1588108769\">Engagio</a>)</li> \n <li>It's estimated that ABM budgets saw an average increase of 41% in 2019. (<a href=\"https://resources.terminus.com/ebooks/ebook-topo-predictions-for-2019/?utm_content=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_source=google&amp;utm_medium=cpc&amp;utm_campaign=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_term=account-based-marketing&amp;gclid=EAIaIQobChMI0fvG54CM6QIVBV8NCh0YQgRnEAAYAyAAEgJdhvD_BwE\">TOPO</a>)</li> \n <li>57% of professionals say their companies target 1,000 accounts or under with ABM. (<a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/topo-2019-account-based-benchmark-report\">TOPO</a>)</li> \n</ul> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/36%20Account-Based%20Marketing%20Stats%20to%20Know%20in%202020.png?width=300&amp;name=36%20Account-Based%20Marketing%20Stats%20to%20Know%20in%202020.png\" alt=\"target account list size average\" width=\"300\" style=\"width: 300px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/topo-2019-account-based-benchmark-report\">Source</a></em></p> \n<ul> \n <li>At the beginning of 2018, only 18% of adopters had two years of experience in account-based marketing. (<u><a href=\"https://resources.terminus.com/ebooks/ebook-topo-predictions-for-2019/?utm_content=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_source=google&amp;utm_medium=cpc&amp;utm_campaign=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_term=account-based-marketing&amp;gclid=EAIaIQobChMI0fvG54CM6QIVBV8NCh0YQgRnEAAYAyAAEgJdhvD_BwE\">TOPO</a></u>)</li> \n <li>In 2018, 18% of account-based programs were run against current customers (larger organizations with more than $1 billion in revenue ran about 50% of these programs. (<u><a href=\"https://resources.terminus.com/ebooks/ebook-topo-predictions-for-2019/?utm_content=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_source=google&amp;utm_medium=cpc&amp;utm_campaign=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_term=account-based-marketing&amp;gclid=EAIaIQobChMI0fvG54CM6QIVBV8NCh0YQgRnEAAYAyAAEgJdhvD_BwE\">TOPO</a></u>)</li> \n <li>The most common metric marketers use to track ABM is revenue won. (<u><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/state-of-marketing\">HubSpot</a></u>)</li> \n <li>Two other metrics marketers most commonly track to measure ABM efforts are the number of pipelines created and account engagement. (<u><a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/2019-abm-market-research-report?_ga=2.185632489.1363335365.1588108769-1977374832.1588108769\">Engagio</a></u>)</li> \n <li>In 2019, 7% of marketers reported a decrease in dedicated headcount for ABM teams, showing that this strategy is going mainstream and being implemented within regular processes. (<u><a href=\"https://www.forrester.com/report/Forrester+Infographic+ABM+Maturity+Corresponds+To+Better+Revenue+Results/-/E-RES157155\">Forrester</a></u>)</li> \n <li>In 2019, 40% of the average marketing team was dedicated to ABM. (<u><a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/2019-abm-market-research-report?_ga=2.185632489.1363335365.1588108769-1977374832.1588108769\">Engagio</a></u>)</li> \n <li>57% of marketers say their organizations have implemented ABM for more than one year. (<u><a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/topo-2019-account-based-benchmark-report\">TOPO</a></u>)</li> \n</ul> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/36%20Account-Based%20Marketing%20Stats%20to%20Know%20in%202020-1.png?width=450&amp;name=36%20Account-Based%20Marketing%20Stats%20to%20Know%20in%202020-1.png\" alt=\"average maturity of account based marketing tactics\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><em><a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/topo-2019-account-based-benchmark-report\">Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>Benefits and Challenges of ABM</h3> \n<ul> \n <li>Marketing and sales teams that take an ABM approach together can be up to six percent more likely to exceed their revenue goals than teams less ABM-advanced. (<a href=\"https://www.forrester.com/report/Forrester+Infographic+ABM+Maturity+Corresponds+To+Better+Revenue+Results/-/E-RES157155\">Forrester</a>)</li> \n <li>62% of marketers say they can measure a positive impact since adopting ABM. (<a href=\"https://www.forrester.com/report/Forrester+Infographic+ABM+Maturity+Corresponds+To+Better+Revenue+Results/-/E-RES157155\">Forrester</a>)</li> \n <li>80% of marketers say ABM improves customer lifetime values, while 86% say it improves win rates. (<a href=\"https://resources.terminus.com/ebooks/ebook-topo-predictions-for-2019/?utm_content=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_source=google&amp;utm_medium=cpc&amp;utm_campaign=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_term=account-based-marketing&amp;gclid=EAIaIQobChMI0fvG54CM6QIVBV8NCh0YQgRnEAAYAyAAEgJdhvD_BwE\">TOPO</a>)</li> \n <li>87% of account-based marketers say that ABM initiatives outperform other marketing investments. (<a href=\"https://www.itsma.com/like-fine-wine-abm-improves-with-age/\">ITSMA</a>)</li> \n <li>One in five accounts targeted through ABM becomes considered a qualified sales opportunity. (<u><a href=\"https://resources.terminus.com/ebooks/ebook-topo-predictions-for-2019/?utm_content=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_source=google&amp;utm_medium=cpc&amp;utm_campaign=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_term=account-based-marketing&amp;gclid=EAIaIQobChMI0fvG54CM6QIVBV8NCh0YQgRnEAAYAyAAEgJdhvD_BwE\">TOPO</a></u>)</li> \n <li>Organizations with a strong <u><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/b2b-outreach-strategy-for-startups\">Ideal Customer Profile (ICP)</a></u> — which is similar to <u><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/buyer-persona-research\">a buyer persona</a></u> — achieve 68% higher account win rates. (<u><a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/topo-2019-account-based-benchmark-report\">TOPO</a></u>)</li> \n <li>More than two-thirds (69%) of top-performing account-based organizations now have a dedicated account based leader. (<u><a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/topo-2019-account-based-benchmark-report\">TOPO</a></u>)</li> \n <li>70% of companies that started account-based initiatives in the first six months of 2019 have dedicated ABM leaders. (<a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/topo-2019-account-based-benchmark-report\">TOPO</a>)</li> \n <li>42% of companies that missed their account-based objectives don't have dedicated leadership. (<a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/topo-2019-account-based-benchmark-report\">TOPO</a>)</li> \n <li>The most common challenge with ABM is delivering a personalized experience. (<u><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/state-of-marketing\">HubSpot</a></u>)</li> \n <li>The top three challenges of implementing ABM are creating a scalable strategy for multiple accounts, producing customized content, and coordinating programs across marketing, sales development, and sales teams. (<a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/topo-2019-account-based-benchmark-report\">TOPO</a>)</li> \n</ul> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/36%20Account-Based%20Marketing%20Stats%20to%20Know%20in%202020-2.png?width=600&amp;name=36%20Account-Based%20Marketing%20Stats%20to%20Know%20in%202020-2.png\" alt=\"biggest account based marketing tactics\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><em><a href=\"https://resources.engagio.com/ebooks/topo-2019-account-based-benchmark-report\">Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>ABM Technology</h3> \n<ul> \n <li>By 2021, over half of all sales phone calls will be analyzed by software. (<a href=\"https://resources.terminus.com/ebooks/ebook-topo-predictions-for-2019/?utm_content=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_source=google&amp;utm_medium=cpc&amp;utm_campaign=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_term=account-based-marketing&amp;gclid=EAIaIQobChMI0fvG54CM6QIVBV8NCh0YQgRnEAAYAyAAEgJdhvD_BwE\">TOPO</a>)</li> \n <li>The conversational intelligence market was estimated to grow by 3x in 2019. (<a href=\"https://resources.terminus.com/ebooks/ebook-topo-predictions-for-2019/?utm_content=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_source=google&amp;utm_medium=cpc&amp;utm_campaign=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_term=account-based-marketing&amp;gclid=EAIaIQobChMI0fvG54CM6QIVBV8NCh0YQgRnEAAYAyAAEgJdhvD_BwE\">TOPO</a>)</li> \n <li>Voice assistants will account for at least half of automated data entry by mid-2020. (<a href=\"https://resources.terminus.com/ebooks/ebook-topo-predictions-for-2019/?utm_content=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_source=google&amp;utm_medium=cpc&amp;utm_campaign=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_term=account-based-marketing&amp;gclid=EAIaIQobChMI0fvG54CM6QIVBV8NCh0YQgRnEAAYAyAAEgJdhvD_BwE\">TOPO</a>)</li> \n <li>An estimated 55% of sales data entry was eliminated by automation by 2020. (<a href=\"https://resources.terminus.com/ebooks/ebook-topo-predictions-for-2019/?utm_content=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_source=google&amp;utm_medium=cpc&amp;utm_campaign=account-based-marketing&amp;utm_term=account-based-marketing&amp;gclid=EAIaIQobChMI0fvG54CM6QIVBV8NCh0YQgRnEAAYAyAAEgJdhvD_BwE\">TOPO</a>)</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Smarketing Benefits and Challenges</h3> \n<ul> \n <li>Organizations with tightly aligned sales and marketing teams experience 36% higher customer retention rates. (<a href=\"http://www.marketingprofs.com/opinions/2016/29174/the-secret-to-account-based-marketing-success\">MarketingProfs</a>)</li> \n <li>The most common measurement of success for content marketing programs is Total Sales. (<a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/state-of-marketing\">HubSpot</a>)</li> \n <li>85% of marketers with an SLA think their marketing strategy is effective. (<a href=\"https://www.stateofinbound.com/?__hstc=20629287.c53847d7cb04720312716e6ce3b1735e.1559596463572.1588099063502.1588105455987.940&amp;__hssc=20629287.3.1588105455987&amp;__hsfp=3157028737\">HubSpot</a>)</li> \n <li>Only 7% of salespeople said leads they received from marketing were very high quality. (<a href=\"https://www.stateofinbound.com/?__hstc=20629287.c53847d7cb04720312716e6ce3b1735e.1559596463572.1588099063502.1588105455987.940&amp;__hssc=20629287.3.1588105455987&amp;__hsfp=3157028737\">HubSpot</a>)</li> \n <li>Only 28% of salespeople said marketing was their best source of leads (<a href=\"https://www.stateofinbound.com/?__hstc=20629287.c53847d7cb04720312716e6ce3b1735e.1559596463572.1588099063502.1588105455987.940&amp;__hssc=20629287.3.1588105455987&amp;__hsfp=3157028737\">HubSpot</a>)</li> \n</ul> \n<h2>Create an Effective ABM Strategy</h2> \n<p>As a marketer, it's important to know what makes ABM techniques successful and how they differ from other target audience marketing tactics.</p> \n<p>Additionally, you'll want to learn about the companies you're interested in marketing to, similar to how you learn about a target audience. For example, before creating an ABM campaign, you'll want to learn about the pain points of companies in your industry, company missions, and what their top decision-makers value in a product or service.</p> \n<p>Once you discover valuable data about the accounts you'd like to market to and feel ready to create a campaign, check out our <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/account-based-marketing-guide\">Ultimate Guide to Account-Based Marketing</a>.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in May 2020 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Faccount-based-marketing-stats&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"3a43b36f8e275201162de2d43d3baf7e","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"pbump@hubspot.com (Pamela Bump)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/36%20Account-Based%20Marketing%20Stats%20to%20Know%20in%202020.png?width=300&name=36%20Account-Based%20Marketing%20Stats%20to%20Know%20in%202020.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn65@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-45-919_45ddc10651e8e33e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/36%20Account-Based%20Marketing%20Stats%20to%20Know%20in%202020-1.png?width=450&name=36%20Account-Based%20Marketing%20Stats%20to%20Know%20in%202020-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn6@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-47-713_fd6efbcb15eb00d3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/36%20Account-Based%20Marketing%20Stats%20to%20Know%20in%202020-2.png?width=600&name=36%20Account-Based%20Marketing%20Stats%20to%20Know%20in%202020-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn70@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-51-134_9e33c1518ef5d28e.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Faccount-based-marketing-stats&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn20@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-51-602_b82a733113aa7ec6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214389714},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:09","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:09","title":"7 Tips for Running Engaging Instagram Giveaways (+Tools to Get You Started)","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-giveaway","description":"<p>With <a href=\"https://business.instagram.com/\">80% of Instagram users following at least one business</a>, it makes sense you want to increase your own visibility and reach on the platform -- but with such immense competition, it can be a difficult task to accomplish.</p>  \n<p>Fortunately, there are a <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/instagram-marketing?_ga=2.226435866.1808936424.1555102735-644648569.1551722047\">few specific Instagram marketing strategies</a> you can implement that have proven effective. For instance, you might optimize your posting times to ensure maximum engagement, partner with an influencer to spread awareness, or designate a content creator to craft more compelling content.</p> \n<p>Additionally, to delight your current followers and attract new visitors to your page, you might consider hosting an Instagram giveaway.</p> \n<p>Simply put, an Instagram giveaway allows you to offer something for free in exchange for an Instagram like, comment, or other pre-determined requirement.</p> \n<p>For instance, take a look at this giveaway from Fabletics:</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/7%20Tips%20for%20Running%20Engaging%20Instagram%20Giveaways,%20Plus%20Examples%20and%20Ideas-1.png?width=600&amp;name=7%20Tips%20for%20Running%20Engaging%20Instagram%20Giveaways,%20Plus%20Examples%20and%20Ideas-1.png\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"Fabletics hosts an Instagram giveaway.\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/Bcz55frHurn/?taken-by=fabletics\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>There are a few reasons why this giveaway works -- first, Fabletics partnered with Blissworld, which enables both businesses to reach the other brand's audience. Second, Fabletics asked viewers to \"tag your bestie\" and follow both brands. This doubles the reach they might've had if they'd only asked one follower to comment.</p> \n<p>When done correctly, giveaways can help you establish your brand on Instagram, cultivate a loyal following, and share your impressive products or services with a larger audience than you could organically.</p> \n<p>Here, we've created a complete guide on how to run your own giveaway, to ensure you're able to delight and engage both new and existing followers on Instagram.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h3>1. Choose the prize for your giveaway.</h3> \n<p>The first thing you'll want to do is decide on the product, service, or experience you'll giveaway as your prize. This will vary depending on your goal -- if you want to spread awareness around a product launch, for instance, you'll likely want to giveaway that specific product as your prize.</p> \n<p>Alternatively, perhaps you want to partner with a brand and create a unique prize that will appeal to each of your audiences.</p> \n<p>Lastly, you might try offering an experience instead of a specific product or service -- like a weekend trip, a spa day, or the chance to meet a leader in your industry.</p> \n<h3>2. Determine the entry-criteria for your contest.</h3> \n<p>Your entry-criteria depends, again, on your ultimate goal. For instance, if you simply want to spread brand awareness, you might ask each participant to like your post and comment with the name of a friend -- this allows you to increase your reach quickly, and could result in new followers.</p> \n<p>Alternatively, maybe you want to draw attention to your blog, or another page on your website. If this is the case, you might ask participants to go to your blog or web page to find entry-criteria there -- such as a question you then want them to answer in your Instagram comments section.</p> \n<p>Lastly, perhaps you've partnered with a brand and, in exchange for one of their products as a prize, they've asked you to include a request to follow <em>their </em>brand as part of your entry-criteria.</p> \n<h3>3. Decide on a goal for your Instagram contest.</h3> \n<p>By determining a specific goal, you're able to tailor your strategy more specifically and keep track of whether or not your giveaway was successful.</p> \n<p>Your goal might be an increase in website traffic, more followers, an increase in engagement, or a boost in sales -- it's to you to choose what makes the most sense for your brand.</p> \n<h3>4. Consider a brand partnership.</h3> \n<p>To explore the benefits of brand partnerships for Instagram giveaways, I spoke with Conor Janda, an Associate Manager of Marketing Partnerships at <a href=\"https://chomps.com/\">Chomps</a>. He told me, \"A giveaway is a nice way to align with peer brands and partners, and drive traffic to your account.\"</p> \n<p>Janda also mentioned giveaways are particularly successful when new brands partner together. \"For instance, a brand might post a recipe, and then mention specific brands in the ingredients section,\" he told me. \"A successful giveaway is typically when a brand partners with a content creator or influencer to make something specific, and then they push that prize out through both of their channels.\"</p> \n<p>Ultimately, a giveaway could allow you to reach a similar brand's followers, and vice-versa -- a win, win.</p> \n<h3>5. Select a campaign hashtag.</h3> \n<p>On Instagram, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-hashtags?_ga=2.119948040.1808936424.1555102735-644648569.1551722047\">hashtags help your content surface</a> on Explore channels, and oftentimes increase visibility on the platform. Consider creating a compelling and unique campaign hashtag to help spread awareness of your giveaway. For instance, along with #giveaway, you might include #winitwednesday #[yourbrand]giveaway #[yourbrand]contest, or something of similar nature.</p> \n<h3>6. Put a time-limit on your contest.</h3> \n<p>Tell your participants how long they have to complete your requirements by putting a time limit in your caption, and then adding \"Giveaway Closed\" at the end of that time. For instance, you might put, \"Giveaway! Over the next 24 hours, please tag a friend in the comments and include your favorite place to travel for a chance to stay overnight at one of our resorts.\"</p> \n<p>The time-limit will ideally create a sense of urgency, and incentivize followers to engage with your post more quickly -- which will also help your giveaway stay at the top of your followers' Instagram feeds.</p> \n<h3>7. Launch and promote your Instagram contest.</h3> \n<p>Once you've chosen your prize, entry-criteria, potential partners, hashtag, time-limit, and goal, you're finally ready to launch and promote your post! Remember, Instagram users <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-best-time-post?_ga=2.119948040.1808936424.1555102735-644648569.1551722047\">favor posts during a certain time in the day</a>, so you'll want to plan wisely.</p> \n<p>Additionally, you'll likely attract further attention to your giveaway if you also post giveaway details on a blog post, Facebook page, or another social channel. Consider where else you can promote your giveaway for optimal results.</p> \n<h2><strong>Instagram Giveaway Rules</strong></h2> \n<p>Instagram's rules are relatively simple when it comes to giveaways.</p> \n<p>First and foremost, it's critical you include a statement like the following, so viewers know your promotion is not tied to Instagram:</p> \n<p><em>\"Per Instagram rules, this promotion is in no way sponsored, administered, or associated with Instagram, Inc. By entering, entrants confirm that they are 13+ years of age, release Instagram of responsibility, and agree to Instagram's terms of use.\"</em></p> \n<p>Additionally, you'll want to ensure you don't ask participants to tag themselves in your content, or tag something that isn't in the photo -- Instagram will penalize you for this.</p> \n<p>Take a look at <a href=\"https://help.instagram.com/179379842258600\">Instagram's promotion guidelines</a> for a full list of rules and regulations.</p> \n<h2><strong>Instagram Giveaway Ideas</strong></h2> \n<p>Once you're ready to post your giveaway, there are a few different action items you might ask your participants to accomplish in exchange for the chance to win.</p> \n<p>Here's a list of some of the more common giveaway ideas:</p> \n<ol> \n <li><strong>Like to win</strong>: Have followers like your post for a chance to win a free product or service. This helps you boost engagement.</li> \n <li><strong>Tag a friend to win</strong>: Have followers tag one of their friends in the comments section for a chance to win. This allows your brand to reach new potential leads on Instagram and grow your audience.</li> \n <li><strong>Like and share to win</strong>: You might ask followers to like your giveaway and repost it on their own channels for the chance to greatly expand your brand's reach -- if ten followers with 100 followers each re-post, that's a chance to reach 1,000 new people.</li> \n <li><strong>Follow to win</strong>: Ask followers to follow your brand, or a partner (or both) for the chance to win. This is a popular tactic since it's an easy way to increase your follower count.</li> \n <li><strong>Photo contest</strong>: Ask participants to upload a photo of themselves using your product or service. This is another easy opportunity to spread brand awareness, since your participants' posts will be seen by their own network of followers and friends. You should ask participants to include your brand's hashtag, or tag your brand, for optimal visibility.</li> \n <li><strong>Caption this</strong>: Some brands post images and leave the caption section blank with a \"Caption this for a chance to win\" command. Your participants will enjoy the chance to offer creative captions for your image, and you'll be able to add the caption to your post with credit to the winner once your giveaway ends.</li> \n</ol> \n<h2><strong>Instagram Giveaway Picker Tools</strong></h2> \n<p>Once you've closed your giveaway contest, it's time to pick a winner -- but how can you do that and ensure fairness?</p> \n<p>There are a few tools you can use to truly randomize your winner. Here are a few options:</p> \n<h3>1. Use a free number generator.</h3> \n<p>While admittedly tedious, particularly if you have hundreds of entries, you might consider counting the total number of participants who engaged with your giveaway, and then using a number generator to select your winner.</p> \n<p>For instance, let's say you count 500 participants in your comments section. Go to Google and type \"random number generator\" into the search box, and Google's number generator will appear as a box in the search results (you can also use another number generator tool, if you want).</p> \n<p>Your minimum should stay 1, and your maximum should be the total number of participants. When you click \"Generate\", the tool will provide a random number. Now, simply go back to your comments section and count until you land on the username that matches that number.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/7%20Tips%20for%20Running%20Engaging%20Instagram%20Giveaways,%20Plus%20Examples%20and%20Ideas-4.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<h3>2. Use Easypromos' Instagram Sweepstakes App.</h3> \n<p>You might consider using a tool like <a href=\"https://www.easypromosapp.com/instagram-sweepstakes/\">Easypromos' Instagram Sweepstakes App</a> to organize your giveaway, which can help you ensure fairness and efficiency when choosing a winner.</p> \n<p>With Easypromos' app, you can filter finalists based on number of mentioned friends. Once you've closed your giveaway, the tool can randomly select between one and 1,000 winners, and alternate winners automatically. The tool provides a test run that you can try before the final draw.</p> \n<p>Best of all, Easypromos' offers a link to a certificate of validity that guarantees the draw has been random, ensuring a level of transparency and honesty between you and your participants. You can customize the certificate for your brand.</p> \n<h3>3. Use a random name picker.</h3> \n<p>This last option is likely the most tedious, but if your giveaway participant pool is relatively small, you could consider using a random name picker to choose your winner by username instead of number. Particularly if you've already compiled your list of names into a spreadsheet, this could be a good option for you.</p> \n<p>To use a random name picker, go to a website like <a href=\"https://www.miniwebtool.com/random-name-picker/\">Miniwebtool.com</a> and input all usernames, each on a separate line, into the text box. Then click the \"Pick a name\" button.</p> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.wishpond.com/hashtag-contest/\">Wishpond</a></h3> \n<p>Wishpond is a great tool that can help you organize and track your Instagram giveaways.</p> \n<p>With Wishpond, you can run an Instagram hashtag giveaway and view all the entrants on your dashboard. You can even add a voting capability for users to vote on the best entry.</p> \n<p>The goal of this type of tool is to help you take your giveaway and promotions to the next level. If you want to run regular contests on Instagram, it might make sense to invest in a platform like this.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://www.easypromosapp.com/\">Easypromos</a></h3> \n<p>Similar to Wishpond, Easypromos makes running an Instagram giveaway or contest a seamless process.</p> \n<p>This tool will help you track comments on one or several posts. It will help you determine if people tagged the right amount of friends in the comments section and help you randomly choose the winner.</p> \n<p>The basic plan is affordable, with no-frills added. This is a great option if you want to run simple giveaways without adding on landing pages or marketing automation.</p> \n<p>Alternatively, if you are running enterprise level giveaways, there are other paid options that will include the features you need.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://woobox.com/\">Woobox</a></h3> \n<p>With Woobox, you can easily create and run successful contests, giveaways, polls, coupons, forms, and more.</p> \n<p>You can download your Instagram comments and pick one or several random winners. Additionally, this tool allows you to easily collect winner contact info and export Instagram comments.</p> \n<p>If you're looking to use an affordable tool, this is an excellent option. There is a free plan for smaller giveaways, but also an enterprise level power plan for larger contests.</p> \n<p>Using a tool is a great way to organize and track your giveaways. Now, let's see what a giveaway looks like in action.</p> \n<h2><strong>Instagram Giveaway Examples</strong></h2> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/dominos/\">Domino's</a></h3> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/7%20Tips%20for%20Running%20Engaging%20Instagram%20Giveaways,%20Plus%20Examples%20and%20Ideas.png?width=600&amp;name=7%20Tips%20for%20Running%20Engaging%20Instagram%20Giveaways,%20Plus%20Examples%20and%20Ideas.png\" alt=\"Dominos Instagram giveaway.\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>One of the more impressive giveaways in this list, Domino's offered the chance to win $10,000 for any participant who followed @Dominos, posted a picture to prove they're a superfan, and used the hashtag #PieceofthePieContest.</p> \n<p>With simple, clear instructions, I'm willing to bet this was a successful giveaway as followers quickly spread the word about their love for Dominos -- and likely incentivized followers to order a pizza from the brand.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/alifedotowsky/\">Ali Fedotowsky</a></h3> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/7%20Tips%20for%20Running%20Engaging%20Instagram%20Giveaways,%20Plus%20Examples%20and%20Ideas-6.png?width=600&amp;name=7%20Tips%20for%20Running%20Engaging%20Instagram%20Giveaways,%20Plus%20Examples%20and%20Ideas-6.png\" alt=\"Ali Fedotowsky hosts an Instagram giveaway.\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>Ali Fedotowsky, a lifestyle and fashion blogger and ex-Bachelorette, partnered with Sole Society to giveaway a pair of loafers and a purse. Since she's also well-known as an affordable fashion influencer, the partnership makes sense, and likely resulted in new followers for both Ali and Sole Society.</p> \n<p>Additionally, Ali wisely instructed participants to check out her blog for the final requirement, likely resulting in an up-tick in traffic.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/cakesmiths.hq/\">Cakesmiths</a></h3> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/7%20Tips%20for%20Running%20Engaging%20Instagram%20Giveaways,%20Plus%20Examples%20and%20Ideas-3.png?width=600&amp;name=7%20Tips%20for%20Running%20Engaging%20Instagram%20Giveaways,%20Plus%20Examples%20and%20Ideas-3.png\" alt=\"Cakesmiths hosted an Instagram giveaway.\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>Cakesmiths does a giveaway every Friday and uses the same hashtag, #FridayFavourite, to evoke loyalty and engagement from their Instagram followers. Cakesmiths is proof you don't need any outrageous prizes for a giveaway -- sometimes, a simple treat will do.</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/diglocalasheville/\">Dig Local Asheville </a></h3> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/7%20Tips%20for%20Running%20Engaging%20Instagram%20Giveaways,%20Plus%20Examples%20and%20Ideas-5.png?width=600&amp;name=7%20Tips%20for%20Running%20Engaging%20Instagram%20Giveaways,%20Plus%20Examples%20and%20Ideas-5.png\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"Dig Local Asheville Instagram giveaway.\">\n</div> \n<p>Dig Local Asheville partnered with @findyourspiritfest to inspire people to visit distilleries in the local Asheville, N.C. area. This is a good example of how you might use your giveaway to increase awareness and excitement regarding one of your company's upcoming events.</p> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/sojosvision/\">SojoS Vision</a></h3> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/7%20Tips%20for%20Running%20Engaging%20Instagram%20Giveaways,%20Plus%20Examples%20and%20Ideas-2.png?width=600&amp;name=7%20Tips%20for%20Running%20Engaging%20Instagram%20Giveaways,%20Plus%20Examples%20and%20Ideas-2.png\" alt=\"SojoS Vision sunglasses giveaway on Instagram.\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>SojoS Vision cleverly asked participants to like six of their photos instead of just one, which likely helped them increase their Instagram engagement rates. Additionally, SojoS included 'Giveaway' text at the top of the image -- if your followers don't often stop to read captions, this is a smart way to draw more attention to your giveaway.</p> \n<p>If you're interested in learning more about Instagram marketing, consider taking an online course, like HubSpot's <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/instagram-marketing\">Instagram Marketing Course</a>.</p> \n<p>Ultimately, running a social media giveaway should help you increase your brand recognition and attract more followers.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in April 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img
